loading.preparingDownload: Please wait while we prepare your download...

home.welcomeTagline: AI-powered documentation for your code repositories
home.description: Generate comprehensive documentation from GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket repositories with just a few clicks.
home.enterRepoUrl: Enter a repository URL in one of these formats:
home.diagramDescription: DeepWiki automatically generates interactive diagrams to help you understand code structure and relationships:

form.addTokens: + Add access tokens for private repositories
form.tokenSecurityNote: Token is stored in memory only and never persisted.

footer.copyright: DeepWiki - AI-powered documentation for code repositories

ask.placeholder: Ask a question about this repository...

repoPage.errorMessageDefault: Please check that your repository exists and is public. Valid formats are "owner/repo", "https://github.com/owner/repo", "https://gitlab.com/owner/repo", "https://bitbucket.org/owner/repo", or local folder paths like "C:\\path\\to\\folder" or "/path/to/folder".
repoPage.selectPagePrompt: Select a page from the navigation to view its content

modelConfig.title: Customizing Model Configuration
modelConfig.aboutDescription: DeepWiki supports multiple AI models through a configuration file called
modelConfig.aboutDescription2: This file defines which models are available in the dropdown menu and their settings.
modelConfig.editFile: Edit the file to add or modify models:
modelConfig.restartServer: Restart the API server for changes to take effect
modelConfig.openaiRequires: Uses OPENAI_API_KEY environment variable by default, or custom API key and base URL in configuration
modelConfig.openaiSupports: Supports custom OpenAI-compatible providers by adding
modelConfig.addToFile: Add this to your generators.json file:
modelConfig.standardOpenaiDescription: This uses the standard OpenAI API with your OPENAI_API_KEY environment variable.
modelConfig.addToUseCustom: Add this to use a custom OpenAI-compatible API:
modelConfig.customOpenaiDescription: This allows you to use any OpenAI-compatible API by specifying a custom base_url and api_key.
modelConfig.completeExampleDescription: After adding the new models, they will appear in the dropdown menu on the homepage.
modelConfig.toLearnHow: to learn how to customize models.
